briefdescription.para: Adds a tag to an entry.

detaileddescription.para: Tagging an entry enables you to search for entries based on their tags. Tags scale across nodes.
The entry must exist.
The tag may or may not exist.
Consider using qdb_add_tags if you are adding several tags to the same entry.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the entry to which the tag must be added.
A pointer to a null terminated UTF-8 string representing the tag to add to the entry

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (qdb_handle_t handle, const char *alias, const char *const *tags, size_t tag_count)
memberdef.name: qdb_add_tags

briefdescription.para: Adds a collection of tags to a single entry.

detaileddescription.para: Tagging an entry enables you to search for entries based on their tags. Tags scale across nodes.
The function will ignore existing tags.
The entry must exist.
The tag may or may not exist.
Consider using qdb_add_tag if you are adding a single tag.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the entry to which the tags must be added.
A pointer to an array a null terminated UTF-8 strings representing the tags to add to the entry
The count of tags to add to the entry.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

briefdescription.para: Tests if an entry has the request tag.

detaileddescription.para: Tagging an entry enables you to search for entries based on their tags. Tags scale across nodes.
The entry must exist.
If you need to test several entries and/or several tags, consider using a batch for maximum performance.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the entry to which the tag must be tested.
A pointer to a null terminated UTF-8 string representing the tag for which presence must be tested

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

briefdescription.para: Removes a tag from an entry.

detaileddescription.para: Tagging an entry enables you to search for entries based on their tags. Tags scale across nodes.
The entry must exist.
The tag must exist.
Consider using qdb_remove_tags if you are removing several tags at once.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the entry to which the tag must be remove.
A pointer to a null terminated UTF-8 string representing the tag to remove

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (qdb_handle_t handle, const char *alias, const char *const *tags, size_t tag_count)
memberdef.name: qdb_remove_tags

briefdescription.para: Removes a collection of tags from a single entry.

detaileddescription.para: Tagging an entry enables you to search for entries based on their tags. Tags scale across nodes.
The entry must exist.
The tags must exist.
Consider using qdb_remove_tag if you are removing a single tag.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the entry to which the tags must be removed.
A pointer to an array a null terminated UTF-8 strings representing the tags to remove
The count of tags to remove to the entry.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (qdb_handle_t handle, const char *tag, const char ***aliases, size_t *aliases_count)
memberdef.name: qdb_get_tagged

briefdescription.para: Retrieves all entries that have the specified tag.

detaileddescription.para: Tagging an entry enables you to search for entries based on their tags. Tags scale across nodes.
The tag must exist.
The complexity of this function is constant.
Consider using qdb_tag_iterator_begin if you expect the number of entries to be very large.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null terminated UTF-8 string representing the tag for which to search entries
A pointer to an array of null terminated UTF-8 string that will list the aliases of the entries having the requested tag.
A pointer to an integer that will receive the number of returned aliases.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (qdb_handle_t handle, const char *alias, const char ***tags, size_t *tags_count)
memberdef.name: qdb_get_tags

briefdescription.para: Retrieves all the tags of an entry.

detaileddescription.para: Tagging an entry enables you to search for entries based on their tags. Tags scale across nodes.
The entry must exist.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null terminated UTF-8 string representing the alias of the entry to which the tag must be added.
A pointer to an array of null terminated UTF-8 string that will list the tags of the entry
A pointer to an integer that will receive the number of returned tags.

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

briefdescription.para: Creates an iterator that will point to the first entry having the the specified tag.

detaileddescription.para: The order in which iteration occurs is unspecified, but entries matching a tag will never appear twice.
Only forward iteration is currently supported.
Once iteration terminates, the caller is responsible for releasing API-allocated resources with qdb_tag_iterator_close
If you expect the number of entries to be very small, you might consider using qdb_get_tagged.

parameterdescription.para: A valid handle previously initialized by qdb_open or qdb_open_tcp.
A pointer to a null terminated UTF-8 string representing the tag on which iteration is requested
A pointer to an uninitialized qdb_const_tag_iterator_t

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

briefdescription.para: Advance a previously initialized iterator to the next entry.

detaileddescription.para: The order in which iteration occurs is unspecified, but entries matching a tag will never appear twice.
Only forward iteration is currently supported.
Once iteration terminates, the caller is responsible for releasing API-allocated resources with qdb_tag_iterator_close
If you expect the number of entries to be very small, you might consider using qdb_get_tagged.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an initialized qdb_const_tag_iterator_t

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

briefdescription.para: Releases all API-allocated resources during a previous iteration.

detaileddescription.para: Once iteration terminates, the caller is responsible for releasing API-allocated resources with qdb_tag_iterator_close

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to an initialized qdb_const_tag_iterator_t

simplesect.para: A qdb_error_t code indicating success or failure.

briefdescription.para: Clones a previously initialized tag iterator.

detaileddescription.para: Copies the state of the original iterator to a new iterator. Both iterators can afterward be independently operated. The cloned iterator will have to be closed with qdb_tag_iterator_close.
